More Notes: Suggests rainfall variability increases precautionary savings, reducing investment (unable to quantify).
Estimates from UNEP (1997) indicating land degradation

This estimates the reduced gap in agricultural production between SSA and non-SSA countries if rainfall conditions were held at pre-1961 means. The year 1985 is chosen to represent the mid-1980s when rainfall was at its lowest.

The absence of the climate changes since the 1960s would have resulted in 32% of the observed gap in agricultural production between SSA and other developing countries by the end of the 20th century. The implied percentage is 100-32 = 68% reduced agricultural production gap due to climate change.
